text:
When starting an apache 2.0.45 with SSL, the Server core dumps:

[Tue May 20 16:32:58 2003] [crit] [Tue May 20 16:32:58 2003] file vhost.c, line
232, assertion "rv == APR_SUCCESS" failed

But only, if 'dns' is not in the /etc/nsswitch.conf. If 'dns' is inscribed in
the nsswitch.conf, Apache starts with no errors. 

The 'dns' entry in the nsswitch.conf works even if no domainname is set and no
/etc/resolv.conf is on the system.

This Problem also does not occure, when "_default_" is replaced with the full
qualified domainname of the server in the VirtualHost definition in ssl.conf.

This Problem occurs on Solaris 8 and Solaris 9.
creator: marco.staub@kippdata.de
trawick@apache.org
text:
so Solaris getaddrinfo() may or may not be able to build a sockaddr from
"255.255.255.255", based on how the resolver is configured?

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
This is an OS bug (Solaris getaddrinfo() failing to represent 255.255.255.255
depending on how the resolver is configured).  It may be fixed in a later
Solaris patch level.

There are at least a couple of work-arounds, which you have indicated.

Hopefully this information will be useful to others that may hit the problem.
